Text: *gasp*

It was Goldy who spoke. But it isn't just himâ€”no one
in attendance can believe their eyes.

His sword has somehow missed Mundane and cut only
air.
(Dammit...!)

Goldy's face twitches. He has left himself fatally
open, and now Mundane is moving.
However...

All Mundane does is slowly unsheathe his sword.
Nothing else.

He lets Goldy's moment of vulnerability pass by
completely, his movement sluggish enough to
suggest that he hasn't even noticed.

Goldy puts some distance between them and then shouts
at Mundane, his eyes flaming with anger.
You making fun of me?!
The irritation in his voice is palpable.
You see that?
Barely.

Not bad. I couldn't catch a thing. And I coulda swore
the Unbeaten Legend's sword connected.

Yeah, normally in that situation there wouldn't have
been enough time to dodge. But...Mundane cracked
his neck just before the blow would've hit.
He cracked his neck?
Yes, like this.
Huh? Wait, hold up. That doesn't make any sense.

I don't understand it either. He tilted his head with
a pop and moved it out of the way of Goldy's swing.

I don't buy that for a second. You're tellin' me he
moved his neck to crack it at just the right time to
dodge the attack? That's way too much of a
coincidence!
But what if it isn't?
What?
Annerose's eyes narrow.

He popped his neck so fast that even I would've
missed it if I wasn't watching carefully. You think
any normal person is capable of that?

Her theory is that popping one's neck at a super
speed, beyond what the eye can track, would be
impossible in normal circumstances.

Urk! You're right...but you saw how that fast that
slice was! Nobody could dodge that with a crack
of the neck even if they tried!

I find it hard to believe, too. And it may have only
been a fluke. But if it wasn't...
Ulp!

I don't like this. You missed a golden
opportunity just now.
How can you be so calm?

That was your once-in-a-lifetime chance to possibly
defeat me, the great Goldy Gilded!

You should be howling in anguish, gnashing your teeth
with vexation, falling to all fours and crawling like
a pathetic wretch! That you fail to do so is an
insult to my honor!

Could it be that you don't even realize what you let
slip away?
Shamed by a worm with a power level of just 17...
I'm coming at you with everything I've got!!!

The air trembles as great quantities of magic begin
to amass, and the crowd goes into an uproar.

The flow of golden energy coalesces into an image of
a glimmering dragon.

Here's a little gift before you die. My power level
is 4,330.
Demonic Golden Dragon! Fatality Strike!!
The golden dragon devoures Mundane.
Or...it was supposed to.

But with what sounds like a sneeze, the beast
abruptly disappears.
Goldy goes whirling through the air.
Blagahargh!
The crowd falls silent.

Everyone looks on in dumbfounded silence as Goldy
falls to the ground with a thud and lays absolutely
still.
Ah...! W-Winner, Mundane Mann!

Mundane has already turned to leave by the time the
referee announces his victory.

Welp, looks like Goldy Gilded wasn't a pushover after
all...

I didn't expect him to be able to visualize his magic
so clearly. If he had aimed for the top and sought
out stronger foes, I'm sure he could've been an
even greater knight.
So what'd Mundane do there at the end?
If I'm not mistaken...he sneezed.
What?

I think perhaps that golden dragon was a bit too
bright to see clearly.

Mundane brought his sword down when he sneezed, and
then Goldy accidentally charged straight into it.

C'mon, that's crazy. A sneeze and a dragon collide,
and the sneeze comes out on top?

Well, that is what actually happened. Goldy claimed
that Mundane missed his one-and-only chance, but it
turns out Mundane never even needed an opening to
win.

Could it be that every second of that match was
an opportunity for him...?
Hmph, that's stupid.

Man, I'm sorry I even asked. If that chump keeps up
his winnin' streak, he'll be up against me in the final
round of the prelims. Then I'll show him for the fraud
he is.
Annerose thinks back on how Mundane moved.
Could I move like he did...?

She cracks her neck and sneezes. Over and over.
Quickly, with as little movement as possible.
*pop*
Achoo!
*pop*
Achoo!
*pop*
Achoo!
Oh...

Finally noticing the weird looks she was getting from
everyone around her, Annerose blushes and flees
the scene.
